titles.title: COVID-19 Origin Act of 2023
COVID-19 Origin Act of 2023

COVIDâ€“19 Origin Act of 2023
COVID-19 Origin Act of 2023
A bill to require the Director of National Intelligence to declassify information relating to the origin of COVID-19, and for other purposes.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 199 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 140, H.J. Res. 27 and S. 619. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 140, under a structured rule. The resolution provides for consideration of H.J.Res. 27 and S. 619, under closed rules. General debate is limited to one hour of debate on all measures.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 199.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 140, H.J. Res. 27 and S. 619. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 140, under a structured rule. The resolution provides for consideration of H.J.Res. 27 and S. 619, under closed rules. General debate is limited to one hour of debate on all measures.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S. 619.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

vote.text: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 419 - 0 (Roll no. 143).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
COVID-19 Origin Act of 2023
This bill requires the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) to declassify all information relating to potential links between the Wuhan Institute of Virology and the origin of COVID-19. The ODNI must submit to Congress an unclassified report with all such information with redactions only as necessary to protect sources and methods.
